questions.question_text:
By default, FortiGate is configured to use HTTPS when performing live web filtering with FortiGuard servers.
Which two CLI commands will cause FortiGate to use an unreliable protocol to communicate with FortiGuard servers for live web filtering? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: C & D is correct. FortiGate_Security_6.4 page 416

C & D
https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD48294

Selected Answer: CD
Fortigate Security 7.0 pg 422
C & D are correct. FortiGate_Security_7.0 page 417

Selected Answer: CD
C & D is correct

Selected Answer: CD
FortiGate_Security_6.4_Study_guide p. 416
1st Disable Anycast, it will allow you access to use protocol udp ( by nature unreliable being stateless)

Selected Answer: CD
Turn off anycast, use UDP.
C & D is correct
C & D is correct. No Doubt.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are correct regarding FortiGate HA cluster virtual IP addresses? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A & C are correct
Correct Answer is A and C - Infrastructure Study Guide pg. 321

Selected Answer: AC
Yes, A and C.
A & C - FortiGate_Infrastructure_7.0 page 326
A & C are correct. Test it on GNS

Selected Answer: AC
A & C are correct
A, D---->https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.0.0/handbook/79908/cli-ha-status

The HA heartbeat IP address displayed by the command is the HA heartbeat IP address of the cluster unit that is actually operating as the primary unit. For a default configuration, this IP address will always be 169.254.0.1 because the cluster unit with the highest serial number will be the primary unit. This IP address changes if the operating primary unit is not the primary unit with the highest serial number.

D is incorrect. 
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.0.0/handbook/644870/ha-heartbeat

FGVM08TM20002729: Secondary, serialno_prio=0, usr_priority=128, hostname=FGVM08TM20002729
FGVM08TM19003638: Primary, serialno_prio=1, usr_priority=128, hostname=FGVM08TM19003638
The member with serialno_prio=0 is assigned IP address 169.254.0.1, serialno_prio=1 is assigned 169.254.0.2, and so forth.
A and C. No doubt.
A & C is correct. No doubt.
Correct Answer is A & D

comments.content:
The correct answer is C, not D. That IP address is assigned to the device with the highest serial number, not the primary. 
Infrastructure page 321.

discussion.content: A & C is correct answer
A & C - FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 321

choices.D: The primary device in the cluster is always assigned IP address 169.254.0.1
choices.A: A change in the virtual IP address happens when a FortiGate device joins or leaves the cluster
choices.C: Virtual IP addresses are used to distinguish between cluster members
choices.B: Heartbeat interfaces have virtual IP addresses that are manually assigned

questions.question_text:
A network administrator has enabled SSL certificate inspection and antivirus on FortiGate. When downloading an EICAR test file through HTTP, FortiGate detects the virus and blocks the file. When downloading the same file through HTTPS, FortiGate does not detect the virus and the file can be downloaded.
What is the reason for the failed virus detection by FortiGate?

discussion.content: B is correct as https traffic requires SSL decryption. Check the ssh inspection profile

Selected Answer: B
Infrastructure 7.0 Study Guide pg. 325

comments.content: Correction it is the Security 7.0 Guide page 325

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - Deep Inspection
Yes B is the correct one
B is correct, need deep ssl inspection
B is correct

choices.D: Antivirus definitions are not up to date

questions.question_text: Which downstream FortiGate VDOM is used to join the Security Fabric when split-task VDOM is enabled on all FortiGate devices?

discussion.content: A is correct. no doubt.

Selected Answer: A
Fortigate Security 7.0 pg 79

Selected Answer: A
A é a verdadeira
'fgfdg dfgfdg dfg dfg df

Selected Answer: A
FortiGate_Security_6.4_Study_Guide-Online p72
"split-task VDOM enabled on the downstream FG, it can only connect to the upstream FG through the downstream FG interface on the root VDOM"
A is correct
A is correct. FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 113

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.
Exhibit A shows system performance output. Exhibit B shows a FortiGate configured with the default configuration of high memory usage thresholds.
Exhibit A.
//IMG//

Exhibit B.
//IMG//

Based on the system performance output, which two statements are correct? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: B & C is correct. FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 417-418 - memory used 90% ->conserved mode

Selected Answer: BC
Fortigate Infrastructure 7.0 pg 367-368

comments.content: Ignore this, it can only be changed when out of conserve mode

discussion.content:
Found here, https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Conserve-mode-changes/ta-p/198502

configurable thresholds
Though it is recommended to keep the default memory threshold, a new CLI command has been added to allow administrators to adjust the thresholds.
 
Default values are : 
- red : 88% of total memory is considered "used memory"
- extreme : 95% of total memory is considered "used memory"
 - green : 82% of total memory is considered "used memory"

I have just changed it on the Fortinet training lab firewall:

Local-FortiGate (global) # show full-configuration | grep memory
 set memory-use-threshold-extreme 97
 set memory-use-threshold-green 83
 set memory-use-threshold-red 89
 set wad-memory-change-granularity 10

Selected Answer: BC
B e C são verdadeiras

Selected Answer: BC
upsolotetely BC

Selected Answer: BC
phototrait right
B&C :FG Infra 7.0 page 383: Not accept config changes, does not run quarantine action - forwarding files to SandBox.

I am not sure why you said B is correct because I was looking and I just found options C&D are correct... if there is any document to prove I can't make a change into conserve mode I want to read it...regards
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.0/cookbook/921599/diagnostics
B & C are correct. page 417-
B and C is correct. No Doubt.
B & C is correct. No Doubt.

comments.content: That's not true. We ran into FGTs going into Conserve a number of times and we could login externally via HTTPS and reboot the devices.

discussion.content: D is also correct, once in Conserve Mode you can only access the FG via the console port.
B & C is correct answer

choices.D: Administrators can access FortiGate only through the console port
choices.A: FortiGate will start sending all files to FortiSandbox for inspection
